channel.title: FindBitMap problem! Help?
channel.description: Please someone help me, if I use like [code]FindBitMap(play,x,y)[/code] It says: [code]Type mismatch in script C:\Documents and Settings...[/code] What did I do wrong?

item.title: FindBitMap problem! Help?
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

It sounds like “play”, “x”, “y” aren’t declared as a right variable. They should all be integers.

Read full topic

item.title: FindBitMap problem! Help?
item.dc:creator: @ScarScape ScarScape
item.description:
@ScarScape wrote:

Hmm… Thanks for helping. This is weird, now i tried that script where were findbitmap problem, now I’m using it and it works now.
And I didn’t change anything in it.

Read full topic

item.title: FindBitMap problem! Help?
item.dc:creator: @Ron Ron
item.description:
@Ron wrote:

ScarScape. Try this…

[scar]
Program FindBitmap;

// Declare variables.
Var
ColorDropper, x, y : Integer;

// Procedure to load the bitmaps.
Procedure LoadBitmaps;
Begin
ColorDropper := BitmapFromString(6, 6, ‘z78DA65CEC10DC0200C03C095E20095’ +
‘7996C2FE2BB5263C229513F9D891B29ED527D79ECD05348205B25’ +
‘21AB37489A6C3E880997D9FE29048A379D2FDAA0B2879379AD790’ +
‘31E55C9276F30DAC526F69DBBFF302B7D42EAA’);
End;

Begin
// Load the bitmaps.
LoadBitmaps;
// If the bitmap ColorDropper is found then…
If(FindBitmap(ColorDropper, x, y))Then
Begin
// Click on it.
ClickMouse(x, y, True);
End;
// Free memory by freeing the bitmap ColorDropper.
FreeBitmap(ColorDropper);
End.
[/scar]

Then compare it to your script and see what you did wrong.

Read full topic

item.title: FindBitMap problem! Help?
item.dc:creator: @Cheesehunk Cheesehunk
item.description:
@Cheesehunk wrote:

Maybe post the whole script?

The problems I’m thinking could be occuring is that you don’t have play declared as an Integer in your script. The only other reason could be a couple lines before it that the error is actually happening.

Read full topic
